title: Paul Gascoigne puffs on a cigarette and poses for snaps with Jill Scott before England game
body_text:
Paul Gascoigne puffs on a cigarette and poses for snaps with Jill Scott before roaring the Three Lions on to 7-0 win over North Macedonia
Paul Gascoigne and Jill Scott joined forces on Monday as they helped roar the Three Lions onto a 7-0 win over North Macedonia.
The former footballers looked in good spirits as they caught up ahead of the match at Old Trafford, larking around before making their way to their seats.
Gazza, 56, was seen puffing away on a cigarette before asking his manager to take a picture of the pair outside the stadium.
Jill, 36, looked effortlessly stylish ahead of her pundit gig, opting for a pair of purple flares that she paired with a periwinkle blue top.
The former Lioness added to her look with a pair of Nike trainers and accessorised with small gold hooped earrings.
Two's company: Paul Gascoigne and Jill Scott joined forces on Monday as they helped roar the Three Lions onto a 7-0 win over North Macedonia
Holy smokes: Gazza, 56, was seen puffing away on a cigarette before asking his manager to take a picture of the pair outside the stadium
It was a great night had by all as Gareth Southgate’s England humiliated North Macedonia with a merciless brand of football that had their opponents psychologically broken by the time we reached the hour mark.
England scored their seven goals in 44 minutes in the middle section of the game and that passage of play either side of half-time really was something to behold.
The stars of the night were many. Captain Harry Kane scored twice. Marcus Rashford was excellent on his home ground as were Jordan Henderson and Trent Alexander-Arnold, playing once again in midfield.
Jack Grealish, meanwhile, emerged as a substitute in the second half to a welcome befitting the country’s new favourite footballer.
But it was Arsenal’s Bukayo Saka who gave us the ‘wow’ moments.
It was Saka who scored a hat-trick and he who lifted this game from the routine to the levels of something much more memorable with three quite lovely goals.
Taking to Instagram after the game, Jill expressed her delight as working as pundit on the game.
Sharing snaps from her time at the match, she penned: 'Still have to pinch myself that this is “work” Well done @england on a great performance!
'Had a great evening in the company of these legends.'
Fun times: The former footballers looked in good spirits as they caught up ahead of the match at Old Trafford, larking around before making their way to their seats
Dressed to impress: Jill, 36, looked effortlessly stylish ahead of her pundit gig, opting for a pair of purple flares that she paired with a periwinkle blue top
All about the accessories: The former Lioness added to her look with a pair of Nike trainers and accessorised with small gold hooped earrings
What have you got there? Jill seemed to be inspecting Gazza's watch outside the stadium
It follows another high for Jill, who garnered 161 caps for the national team, and appeared at no fewer than nine major tournaments in her storied career.
The Queen Of The Jungle made history this month as the first female to captain England in this year's Soccer Aid for UNICEF charity match.
Yet despite her best efforts, Jill's team ended up losing for a fifth year in a row as the World XI reigned victorious yet again.
Usain Bolt captained his side to another success in a team also featuring footballing legends Hernan Crespo and Roberto Carlos, while England were captained by Euros-winning Lioness Jill Scott.
The management teams were equally star-studded, with England's camp including Chelsea women's boss Emma Hayes, Stormzy and Harry Redknapp, while Mauricio Pochettino teamed up with Mel C for the World XI.
